The correct answer is C: [00:01:08 - 00:01:36]. 

In the provided audio clip, the speaker defines one astronomical unit (AU) as the average distance from Earth to the Sun, which is approximately 93 million miles or 149.6 million kilometers. The speaker also mentions that 1 AU is the distance light travels in 8 minutes and 20 seconds and 50 AU is 7 hours of light travel. These additional details about the scale of the solar system are presented in relation to the diagrams showing the orbits of outer planets like Neptune, Uranus, and Saturn.
